results.title: Breath death: a tragedy in masks
results.creator_credit: S. Vanderbeek and A Visible Fill'm
results.brief_description: An anti-war collage composed of fleeting black and white visual using a variety of animation techniques. The tone of this experimental film is surreal using sources of images and sounds from the 20th Century, opening with the rhythm from Screamin’ Jay Hawkins’ ‘I Put a Spell on You’. Soundtrack by Jay Watt.

results.title: Comput-her baby
results.creator_credit: Dave Goldson, Neal Chastain and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A humorous but pointed satire on computer dating. Accompanied by ironically contrasting musical background, human voices reveal personal statistics for consumption by the computer. Compares cybernetic matching and old-fashioned computers, and questions the relationship between people and computers.

results.title: Quick rise
results.brief_description: Time lapse photography is used to speed up the action in a town and a twenty storey building goes from ground level to completion in hour minutes. Visual speed is enhanced by a lively Bach piece preformed on a Moog synthesiser.

results.title: Film: the art of the impossible
results.brief_description: Film director Michael Ritchie analyses selected sequences from well known films and demonstrates some of the devices used to make scenes realistic and to create drama. Includes the use of the camera, sound, lighting, script, casting choices and direction of actors, sets, costumes and music.

results.title: Pygmies of the Ituri Forest
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Hallet and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Records the many aspects of the life of the Efe Pygmies of Zaire, Africa. Pygmies cease to grow after eight - nine years but they also mature incredibly quickly and are ready for marriage at this age. Looks at thier ceremonies and rituals and at exploitation and destruction of their home forest.

results.title: Introduction to movement education
results.brief_description: Illustrates the enthusiastic reaction of children to the problem-solving approach to gymnastics. Explains movement language, teaching methods, and safety aspects. Presents movement education as a throught-provoking philosophy and an area of physical education catering for all levels of performance. Suitable for teacher tertiary levels.

results.title: Tangram
results.brief_description: Uses animation of the seven geometric pieces of the tangram, an ancient Chinese puzzle, to show the kinds of patterns which can be created.

results.title: The tree of truth
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
The story of a land with a magic tree that provides true or false answers to any problem posed. The king poses a question about wealth - experts disagree as to whether it is an addition or a sub-traction problem, although the tree maintains both methods are acceptable.
Previewing is essential. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
